intro: Mikania verapazensis, commonly known as the Verapaz Mikania, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds in achenes. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
